column4: I have 2 folders inside my external HDD one with 80 subdirs, another with 40 subdirs
a:80, b:40, all the folders in b are also in a, I want all folders that are in already in b and a at the same time to be deleted
oh
i want it so A only keeps the subdirs that are not in B
im not sure im making myself clear
Chotaz; that might be more than one line...
i really have no idea, but my cousin decided to screw my music folder
he managed to devide my music collection in 2 dirs
and then shoved some duplicates into one of those dirs
both A and B are sub-dirs in the same directory ? and You do want to keep only one unique copy of each directory, correct ?
the A and B dirs are completely apart and far inside the hdd
k
my ideia is to delete every subdirectory from B that already exists in A
quick and dirty would be to just move all the dirs in B to A, overwriting any duplicates; leaving you with just one version lest ofc the dir structure is different
and ofc assuming you have the free space for it
I dont want to lose this structure and I'm not sure if I have the space even
he just copied all the dirs from A to B, leaving me with a bunch of duplicates
I thought that'd be an easy, script-way out
Chotaz; i think a script may be tricky if the dir structure is completely different
/media/MyBook/Music/GenreA/Flac vs /media/MyBook/GenreB/Flac
there is always mc and some elbow grease ;)
